title: Sporting Lisbon consider renaming stadium after Cristiano Ronaldo once Portuguese superstar retires
text:
Sporting Lisbon are considering renaming their stadium after Cristiano Ronaldo when he retires.

Ronaldo burst onto the scene as a teenager for the Portuguese club before securing his move to Manchester United.

He is unquestionably the club's most famous academy product and they are thinking about honouring him when he hangs up his boots.

Cristiano Ronaldo could have the Sporting Lisbon stadium renamed in his honour

The Estadio Jose Alvalade is currently named after Sporting Lisbon's founder

Sporting president Frederico Varandas told Tuttosport: 'It’s a theory we will not shelve and obviously we’d be very proud to have his name associated with us.

'Cristiano is and always will be one of the greatest symbols in the history of our club.

He went on to explain how important it is that the Juventus forward is used to inspire the next generation at Sporting.

Ronaldo broke through at Sporting and is the club's most famous former player

'We’re already keeping his values on the walls of the youth academy, focusing on passion, sacrifice, discipline, leadership and determination.

'Cristiano is certainly the best Portuguese player of all time and one of the best athletes in the history of the sport.'

It is now 17 years since Ronaldo made waves at the Sporting academy and not doubt he'd relish having the stadium named after him.

The 50,000-seater arena is called Estadio Jose Alvalade after the club's founder and first member.
description: Sporting Lisbon are considering renaming their stadium after Cristiano Ronaldo when he retires. Ronaldo burst onto the scene as a teenager for the Portuguese club.
